review:
Ah, Overwatch 2, the game that's been "coming soon" for so long, I started to think it was sponsored by that one friend who's always late to the party. But hey, good things come to those who wait, right? Well, after waiting for centuries, I finally got my hands on Overwatch 2, and let me tell you, it's like they put the "hi" back in "wait."

First of all, let's talk about the new heroes. They've got Sojourner, who looks like she's been hitting the gym and the library simultaneously. She's got the kind of biceps that could give Reinhardt a run for his armor. But you know, for someone who's all about knowledge and enlightenment, she sure spends a lot of time hanging out in the battlefield shooting stuff. Maybe her "intellectual conversations only" Zoom call got canceled.

And then there's good ol' Junkrat, the explosive jester himself. He's still as lovable as ever, with his wild cackles and knack for turning every fight into a pyrotechnic extravaganza. I swear, if Overwatch was a sitcom, Junkrat would be the wacky neighbor who accidentally blows up his own mailbox every week. But hey, at least he's consistent!

Now, let's talk about the maps. Blizzard seems to have taken the "world tour" approach, as we're traveling to all these cool locations like Rome, Rio, and New York. It's like they decided, "Hey, saving the world is great, but have you tried doing it while enjoying some gelato?" I can just imagine the Overwatch team's brainstorming session: "Okay, we've got Paris. Now let's add the Eiffel Tower as a payload. Genius!"

And can we talk about the game's title, "Overwatch 2"? It's like they went, "Hey, sequels need numbers, but let's not get too crazy. Just slap a '2' on there and call it a day." It's like naming the second kid in a family "Junior" because you couldn't be bothered to come up with a new name. Classic move.

But jokes aside, Overwatch 2 does promise some pretty exciting updates. The story mode looks like a blast, and the new PvP changes have everyone buzzing like a certain electric scientist. So, after all is said and done, I have to admit, Overwatch 2 might have taken its sweet time, but just like a fine wine or a perfectly timed "Nerf this!" explosion, it's worth the wait.

Rating: 5/5 exploding piÃ±atas â€“ Unexpectedly explosive, and full of colorful surprises!

Thank you Blizzard for putting your game on a platform like steam where people can leave reviews. Good Luck ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚

I was on the fence about what kind of review to leave.
The only reason this review is positive is because the game is still fun to play. Though idk for how long that will be the case if they release heroes like Lifeweaver.
All the hate for Overwatch 2 is justified and stems from deep frustration.
Being unable to deliver what's promised is fine by me, but what's not is deceiving and depriving players who've played since the launch. We had a model where we could earn all the loot just by playing, and that there was massive incentive for most people to play. It felt like you were making progress towards a goal when playing. That model was a little generous imo but then they did a 180.
Now you pay for everything and the prices are downright absurd. You even pay for unlocking new game modes even!!! Like wtf.
There's little reason to play anymore other than the satisfaction of getting headshots with Hanzo or McCree. 
The Overwatch 2 update was a massive middle finger to all players who have been playing from the start and was a blatant and shameless "screw you, we just want money". 
Even around the time when Overwatch was released I used to think, "That's a Blizzard game. It's going to be in a league of its own". Its a shame that the reverence I once had for Blizzard is long gone, and the change in management or merging with Actitvsion or whatever now makes me look at any new game from them and go, "whatever".
I wonder what kind of reviews Diablo 4 will get if its ever ported to Steam. Little doubts about the reception it'll have.
I miss old Blizzard, the giant beacon in the industry that once was. I miss daddy Jeff and his dev update videos. Sadly that era is gone and now we have their successors sabotaging their legacy.
bring back lootboxes and im good

ĞŸĞ¾Ğ»Ğ¾Ğ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ·Ñ‹Ğ² Ğ½ĞµĞ´Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑƒĞ¿ĞµĞ½ Ğ² Ğ²Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞ¼ Ñ€ĞµĞ³Ğ¸Ğ¾Ğ½Ğµ ğŸ¤¡

Like anything it's fun with friends !! 

Pales in comparison to tf2, though. The gamemode "no limits", as well as various custom gamemodes made by the community is about the only real fun one can have with this game. With friends.

The greedy corporate practices made by this company are horrible, selling skins for upwards of $20 per hero(in a game with like 30+ heros?) as well as putting shitty co-op missions behind a paywall. Furthermore, a lot of cosmetic packs contains shit nobody asked for or wants(what's the point of souvenirs??) just to artificially inflate the already predatory prices further. I believe there used to be a pack for $42 that included 2 skins and some other gaudy garbage.

1/10.

In isolation the game itself is quite fun, but the way Blizzard promoted this game (promising interesting PVE modes, PVE RPG-like character development and so on) and then not living up to those promises is totally unacceptable.
20 USD for a single hero,What a  incredable price even compares to drugs
